title: What if Fiddlesticks is the "darkness" that Swain has foreseen?
body:
[](https://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/05_Fiddlesticks_Concept_8dxaci0dk4z1tmbvmvxm.jpg)
[With the recent revelations we have gotten from the Roadmap](https://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/en-us/2019/10/champion-roadmap-october-2019/) came an update concerning our beloved Fiddlesticks, resident devil-out-of-nothing, harvester of mankind, and bringer of death and madness.

There has been a certain amount of speculation on what the threat that Swain has glimpsed through his scrying is supposed to be, the most common answer given being either Mordekaiser or the Void. Others have speculated about it being the Darkin, demons, the Black Mist, the Swimming City, or other, more specific assumptions. [According to Interlocutioner](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/jsdqvwff-ask-me-anything-about-narrative-for-warwick-urgot-swain-nunu-willump-and-pantheon-vgus?comment=000e0000), **_none_** of these guesses have been right.

So, _what if it's Fiddlesticks_?

Fiddlesticks is supposedly an ancient evil—a darkness from beyond mortal comprehension, incalculable and inexorable, a portent of extinction to mankind that appears out of nowhere and has unknown motivations—and a danger which is seemingly not connected to any monsters we have learned of so far. Fiddlesticks isn't a demon, a horror of the Void, or a fallen Ascended: he is a wholly different sort of enemy for Runeterra to go up against.

Fiddlesticks' narrative is supposed to draw upon cosmic and religious horror, and his lead writer has expressed a desire to turn him into a proper harbinger of dark times ahead, a being that heralds the coming of greater terrors, which is also thematically cohesive with his gameplay focus of jumpscares and the spreading of fear in enemies.

Fiddlesticks could perhaps be a representation of the formless chaos of existence, the absence of sanity and logic, the concentrated discord of creation, or another darkness entirely, but he may very well be what Swain is so worried about. For, if such a nightmarish apparition is merely a harbinger of worse things to come, what kind of abominations could possibly be lurking on the horizon?

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Carnival Knights,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=dr1hukAK,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2019-10-17T17:11:37.935+0000)
>
> {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

So Fiddle is just gonna be like creepy "mothman" ?/??????? and Lissandra thought she has it bad
He is a soul of dead poro trapped in a scarecrow.
lol. a crow that warns of a scarecrow... that's a waifu romcom in the making.
meme hit

> [{quoted}](name=BLACK REALM GOD,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=dr1hukAK,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-10-17T10:55:29.596+0000)
>
> lol. a crow that warns of a scarecrow... that's a waifu romcom in the making.

That's why its a scarecrow

Interesting outlook on Fiddlesticks, it would actually be really interesting if what Swain fears most is not Mordekaisers return, but Fiddlesticks and what potential abominations are to come with him.
See, here's the thing: With a name like Fiddlesticks, which sounds like just something characters use in kid's cartoons because they can't curse, I can't take this character seriously.

That's a common trope in the horror genre, usually unfathomably evil beings having deceptive names. Chucky, Jason, Pennywise the dancing clown, Freddy, Michael, Pinhead, Norman Bates. Be it human or inhuman, those threats rarely get names like "super mega death monster" because of the chilling contrast between their binary personas.

> [{quoted}](name=NelsieLisnen,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=dr1hukAK,comment-id=000c0000,timestamp=2019-10-17T20:44:21.339+0000)
>
> That's a common trope in the horror genre, usually unfathomably evil beings having deceptive names. Chucky, Jason, Pennywise the dancing clown, Freddy, Michael, Pinhead, Norman Bates. Be it human or inhuman, those threats rarely get names like "super mega death monster" because of the chilling contrast between their binary personas.

dont forget pumpkinhead

With Freddy, Jason, Michael, and Norman, they were all People at some point. Sure, they may have been evil people, but they were somewhat 'human' killers.

Fiddlesticks is supposedly some kind of eldritch or Lovecraftian horror, whose most famous monster was C'thulu. Imagine if that, the penultimate horror, destroyer of worlds, was named something like Dinkleberg. Would you be able to take it seriously?

Riot specifically stated back during the first Fiddle and Voli only roadmap that the name "Fiddlesticks" is the name a child would come up with, not something a mage would name their newly summoned demonic minion. He's a ghost story/thought form, likely taking on many names and forms over the countless years he has existed as people retell his story over and over again.

Something like the Candyman from the Candyman film series. The more people believe that Fiddlesticks exists, the more "real" he becomes. He could be like an idea becoming a physical being by the power of belief. Fiddlesticks could lose power and perhaps his physical body if people stopped believing that he's real.

Yes, that is basically what a thought form is. Sorry, I think that's purely Supernatural terminology.

But yeah, basically, thought forms change depending on the story, and the belief of the story. If you accept the story as fact, then they're real. If people believe the tale of a metal scarecrow named Fiddlesticks that eats children, then that's what he'll be. If people believe he's a harmless puppy, though, then that's what he'll become.

> [{quoted}](name=Ionian Vulpix,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=dr1hukAK,comment-id=000c00000001,timestamp=2019-10-18T00:27:57.991+0000)
>
> With Freddy, Jason, Michael, and Norman, they were all People at some point. Sure, they may have been evil people, but they were somewhat 'human' killers.
> 
> Fiddlesticks is supposedly some kind of eldritch or Lovecraftian horror, whose most famous monster was C'thulu. Imagine if that, the penultimate horror, destroyer of worlds, was named something like Dinkleberg. Would you be able to take it seriously?

again, pumpkinhead and pinhead. abominations dont need intimidating names

You picked the ones that suit you. Pennywise though. Pinhead as well. And as someone pointed out, Pumpkinhead. All are supernatural horror, so yeah, there is precedent. The point of those names is always rooted in a universal truth. Evil rears its ugly head, it is conniving and deceptive, belieing a scary truth, it doesn't have to be in name only. Would you ever be scared of a goofy clown, well, not until it turns into a hypnotic, man eating insect. A lot of people appreciate the contrast, you don't, that's what I got.
My spook boi is actually becoming spooky. What

> formless chaos of existence, the absence of sanity and logic, the concentrated discord of creation

isn't that pretty much shaco?
At the moment, Shaco is just a guy who dresses as a clown and likes to stab people in the butt. He has no lore.
Actually he's currently a cursed marionette that likes to stab people in the butt. That is his single line of current lore found in loading screen tips.
Whatever they make him when they rework him (Because Arceus knows he needs it), be it a puppet, a guy, an entity, a demon, etc, they need to keep the butt stabbing.
perfect definition

He's one of the earlier champions, back when Riot made literally any trope they could into a champion. Hence why there was a random Spartan Warrior, an armored bear, a scarecrow, a Darth Vader ripoff, and a murderous clown.
that's literally false though. he has lore, it's short but it's there.

> [{quoted}](name=Ionian Vulpix,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=dr1hukAK,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2019-10-17T19:11:48.541+0000)
>
> At the moment, Shaco is just a guy who dresses as a clown and likes to stab people in the butt. He has no lore.

you mean puppet not guy

It's pretty clear from the cinematography of Swain's trailer that the darkness is Mordekaiser, considering the doors slam shut behind him at the end showing the Noxus crest which is based on Morde's helmet with red glowing eyes.

That being said, I am interested to see what "ancient evil" Fiddlesticks is. The fact that he has some mechanical parts and may not turn out to be a demon in the same sense that Tahm and Eve are is super interesting. He's super scary already and he isn't even finished yet.
Scarecrow Pennywise
wow this is a great theory

Wouldn't be surprising, as his new palette is very reminescent of that of Beatrice (black and red). I think that they'll be somewhat connected, even tho I'd personally prefer Fiddlesticks to be mysterious and unexplained.

I thought it was Nocturne 
{{sticker:sg-lulu}}

Swain and Fiddlesticks have always been connected in my eyes just because of their use of foreboding birds. T?hen Swain straight up became a demon hybrid man, which is what Fiddle was as well. Can't not have something between them
I'm with it.

I dunno if I really buy this theory. It would bee too much like a meme if Swain's raven demon was terrified of a murderous scarecrow, to the point where I think the lore would absolutely jump the shark if this was the case.
to me fiddle looks like your typical local horror monster rather than a massive threat but depending on how the writers handle it and what theyre planning this could change.
